I hate having to read my old entries to figure out where I left off...

I swear, I will update this more.

That's a lie...I know it as well as you.

To begin, I have to get something off my chest - go figure.  I AM SCARED AS SHIT ABOUT ALL THIS COLLEGE HOOPLAH!  That's right, hooplah.  I have to finish the EASTMAN application which is abooooouuuuuttttt as long as my life.  I am scared I am not going to get it done.  NAZ is all done.  I just have to mail it.  Talk about coming close to a deadline.  I have like 9 notices from EASTMAN telling me "Your application is pending finalization.  YOU MUST COMPLETE IT!"  To that I say, Fuck you and wait.  I still have...ummm, 4 days?

I love winter.  It is my favorite season.  I know this is weird, but being at the gas pump at winter smelling the gas makes me crave snowmobiling like a fat kid and cake.  Mmmm - cake.  I also love the sereneness (fuck spelling) of winter.  Everything is so crisp and perfect, even the snowfalling.  No matter the rate, it always looks beautiful.  You ever notice that the air seems cleaner in the winter?  It feels that way.  I don't mind the cold taking my breath away because the air I get back always seems somehow better.  

Musical Auditions are over.  I got Bert...something another.  All I know is I sing some big number called DAMES and marry Kare (rhyme much?) in the role of ANYTIME ANNIE.  Sweet.

I SAW RENT!  I can't lie, this statement just made me remember when Amanda Tennis, Zach, and myself were outside of Oratorio Society and she said "I saw SAW!" and then proceeded to half kneel and make a field goal symbol with her arms.  Truly humorous.  Again, fuck spelling.

Anyway, RENT - I have seen it 3 times on stage, and always amazing.  In my top 5 of favorite shows, it had a lot to own up to, and it delivered like Dominoe's.  It was sooooo true to the script.  It just warmed my fat lil heart...lil, ha!
I was a little depressed some people couldn't come, but what are you going to do?  Life's a bitch, prolly the biggest bitch of them all.

I also just saw HARRY POTTER.  Again, amazing.  When did Harry get abs?  Dane and I both noticed...what the hell happened?  I mean come on now...I want abs...and magic.  At least one I can work towards, abs I will never have - get the joke?
...In my internal monologue I just said "Hoke", like spainish...no? ok...

My Grandfather did pass away.  I am saddened by this, a great deal.  He was one of those men you were lucky if you knew, and if you didn't you wish you had someone like him in your life.

I keep thinking about the loyal few who check this and the random people who come along once in a while.  I beg of you this time, I love comments - please leave me some.  Everytime you come, just leave one.  They make me feel like I am an aide to your life.  Even if I am not, it is still nice to dream.  Oh life...

I can not begin to sum up the change in me...

...alas, effort is what makes will.

I feel as though a chapter in my life is closing, and honestly, it was a great ride, but some people grow up and away and other stay still within their enviroment.  Not neccesarily a place, as appropriate as that may be right now, but in past ideals that haven't developed further.  Like change is fear rather than growth.  

A month away was good for me.  I am not going to say I realized who my friends are.  I realized who has truly impacted  my life and that is what matters to me.  Not to say that those who haven't yet or may never are meaningless, for that would be terrible.  Those are the people I have time to grow with.  These are the people I appreciate.  The ones who have grown with me, changed me for the better, and have alloted time to grow with.  

So, now that this chapter of 1 year, 1 full year that has had insane highs and lows throughout is has closed, a brand new one has opened...for me.  I will not waste it.  This is my future.  You want to mess with it, fine, I can't stop you; but, you better have the balls to do it through me.  What's stranger yet is I never lost anything.  You never lose, you always gain.  Ever expierience is an appreciation for what was, could, or should have been there.  That is the growth within.  

I was starting to become depressed and I hated it.  Then I realized, I can take back everything I can control, which is soley myself.  That, I did.  

So I beg of you, all of you, please, be a part of me, or let it go.  This is my ride, my life, and I am NOT getting off.
